org.typemeta.funcj.parser

Class Combinators

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.typemeta.funcj.parser.Combinators

  • public abstract class Combinators
extends Object
    Combinators provides functions for combining parsers to form new parsers.

    • Constructor Summary

        Parameters:

      • product

        public static <I,A,B> Parser<I,Tuple2<A,B>> product(Parser<I,A> pa,
                                                    Parser<I,B> pb)
        Combine two parser to form a parser which applies both parsers, and if they are both successful then returns a Tuple2 of the results.
        Type Parameters:
        I - the input stream symbol type
        A - the result type of first parser
        B - the result type of second parser
        Parameters:
        pa - the first parser
        pb - the second parser
        Returns:
        a parser that applies two parsers consecutively and returns the pair of values

      • product

        public static <I,A,B,C> Parser<I,Tuple3<A,B,C>> product(Parser<I,A> pa,
                                                        Parser<I,B> pb,
                                                        Parser<I,C> pc)
        Combine three parsers to form a parser which applies all parsers, and if they are successful then returns Tuple3 of the results.
        Type Parameters:
        I - input stream symbol type
        A - the result type of first parser
        B - the result type of second parser
        C - the result type of third parser
        Parameters:
        pa - the first parser
        pb - the second parser
        pc - the third parser
        Returns:
        a parser that applies two parsers consecutively and returns the pair of values

      • many

        public static <I,A> Parser<I,IList<A>> many(Parser<I,A> p)
        A parser which repeatedly applies p until it fails, and then returns an IList of the results. Note, if p fails on the first attempt then this parser succeeds, with an empty list of results.
        Type Parameters:
        I - the input stream symbol type
        A - the parse result type
        Parameters:
        p - the parser to be applied repeatedly
        Returns:
        a parser which applies p zero or more times until it fails

      • many1

        public static <I,A> Parser<I,IList.NonEmpty<A>> many1(Parser<I,A> p)
        A parser which applies p one or more times until it fails, and then returns an IList of the results. Note, if p fails on the first attempt then this parser fails.
        Type Parameters:
        I - the input stream symbol type
        A - the parser result type
        Parameters:
        p - the parser to be applied repeatedly
        Returns:
        a parser which applies p repeatedly until it fails

      • skipMany

        public static <I,A> Parser<I,Unit> skipMany(Parser<I,A> p)
        A parser which applies p zero or more times until it fails, and throws away the results. Note, if p fails on the first attempt then this parser succeeds.
        Type Parameters:
        I - the input stream symbol type
        A - the parser result type
        Parameters:
        p - the parser to be applied repeatedly
        Returns:
        a parser which applies p repeatedly until it fails

      • sepBy

        public static <I,A,SEP> Parser<I,IList<A>> sepBy(Parser<I,A> p,
                                                 Parser<I,SEP> sep)
        A parser which applies p zero or more times until it fails, alternating with calls to the sep parser. The results of the p parser are collected in a IList and returned by the parser.
        Type Parameters:
        I - the input stream symbol type
        A - the parser result type
        SEP - the separator type
        Parameters:
        p - the symbol parser
        sep - the separator parser
        Returns:
        a parser which applies p zero or more times alternated with sep

      • sepBy1

        public static <I,A,SEP> Parser<I,IList<A>> sepBy1(Parser<I,A> p,
                                                  Parser<I,SEP> sep)
        A parser which applies p one or more times until it fails, alternating with calls to the sep parser. The results of the p parser are collected in a IList and returned by the parser.
        Type Parameters:
        I - the input stream symbol type
        A - the parser result type
        SEP - the separator type
        Parameters:
        p - the symbol parser
        sep - the separator parser
        Returns:
        a parser which applies p one or more times alternated with sep

      • optional

        public static <I,A> Parser<I,Optional<A>> optional(Parser<I,A> p)
        A parser that applies the p parser, and, if it succeeds, returns the result wrapped in an Optional, otherwise returns an empty Optional.
        Type Parameters:
        I - the input stream symbol type
        A - the parser result type
        Parameters:
        p - the symbol parser
        Returns:
        an optional parser

      • between

        public static <I,A,OPEN,CLOSE> Parser<I,A> between(Parser<I,OPEN> open,
                                                   Parser<I,CLOSE> close,
                                                   Parser<I,A> p)
        A parser for expressions with enclosing symbols.

        A parser which applies the open parser, then the p parser, and then close parser. If all three succeed then the result of the p parser is returned.

        Type Parameters:
        I - the input stream symbol type
        A - the enclosed parser result type
        OPEN - the open parser result type
        CLOSE - the close parser result type
        Parameters:
        open - the open symbol parser
        close - the close symbol parser
        p - the enclosed symbol parser
        Returns:
        a parser for expressions with enclosing symbols

      • choice

        public static <I,A> Parser<I,A> choice(Parser<I,A>... ps)
        A parser that attempts one or more parsers in turn and returns the result of the first that succeeds, or else fails.
        Type Parameters:
        I - the input stream symbol type
        A - the parser result type
        Parameters:
        ps - the var-arg list of parsers
        Returns:
        a parser that attempts one or more parsers in turn

      • choice

        public static <I,A> Parser<I,A> choice(IList.NonEmpty<Parser<I,A>> ps)
        A parser that attempts one or more parsers in turn and returns the result of the first that succeeds, or else fails.
        Type Parameters:
        I - the input stream symbol type
        A - the parser result type
        Parameters:
        ps - the list of parsers
        Returns:
        a parser that attempts one or more parsers in turn

      • chainl1

        public static <I,A> Parser<I,A> chainl1(Parser<I,A> p,
                                        Parser<I,Functions.Op2<A>> op)
        A parser for an operand, followed by one or more operands that separated by operators. This can, for example, be used to eliminate left recursion which typically occurs in expression grammars.
        Type Parameters:
        I - the input stream symbol type
        A - the parser result type
        Parameters:
        p - the parser
        op - the parser for the operator
        Returns:
        a parser for operator expressions
